result.execSummary:
The defendant Lewis Chester Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 01/08/2016 @ 1:15pm, Br-38

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by DOC's. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- Restitution is set at ZERO.
- No contact with firearms. 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

- Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
- AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
- NO NEW VIOLATIONS.

timeConds.notes:
01-08-16/ Judge Jeffrey A Wagner
Defendant is non-compliant with Probation conditions.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 5 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC.

STAYED; pending review on 01-08-16 at 1:15pm Br-38

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lewis Chester Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 01-08-16 Court order imposing 5 days of condition time.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant called Atty Lamke stating he is ill and cannot appear today. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is not compliant.  Court ordered defendant to serve 5 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Lewis Chester Taylor in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction,  with credit for 42 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 20 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-Restitution is set at ZERO
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Lewis Chester Taylor in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial however, parties have reached a resolution.

As to Count 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

As to Count 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to the case for the purposes of sentencing.

Case adjourned to Branch 38.

Pretrial incarceration credit sheet received and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM036110  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08-01-2015

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Lewis Chester Taylor not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery received by defense counsel.  Offer will be forwarded to defense counsel, per the State.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 9-9-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Joann M.; Deborah M. ot Tino B.

Defendant Lewis Chester Taylor in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Lewis Chester Taylor in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
